arabic_text: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 23.1 Qad 'Aflaĥa Al-Mu'uminūna

translations.english_saheeh: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:
translations.english_hilali_khan: Successful indeed are the believers.
translations.english_rwwad: The believers have attained true success:

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي صَلَاتِهِمۡ خَٰشِعُونَ
phonetic: 23.2 Al-Ladhīna Hum Fī Şalātihim Khāshi`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: They who are during their prayer humbly intent
translations.english_hilali_khan: Those who offer their Salât (prayers) with all solemnity and full submissiveness.
translations.english_rwwad: those who humble themselves in their prayers,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَنِ ٱللَّغۡوِ مُعۡرِضُونَ
phonetic: 23.3 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum `Ani Al-Laghwi Mu`riđūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they who turn away from ill speech
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who turn away from Al-Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk, falsehood, and all that Allâh has forbidden).
translations.english_rwwad: and those who turn away from all that is vain,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ لِلزَّكَوٰةِ فَٰعِلُونَ
phonetic: 23.4 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum Lilzzakāati Fā`ilūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they who are observant of zakāh
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who pay the Zakât.
translations.english_rwwad: and those who give zakah,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ لِفُرُوجِهِمۡ حَٰفِظُونَ
phonetic: 23.5 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum Lifurūjihim Ĥāfižūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they who guard their private parts
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who guard their chastity (i.e. private parts, from illegal sexual acts)
translations.english_rwwad: and those who guard their sexual desires,

arabic_text: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ
phonetic: 23.6 'Illā `Alá 'Azwājihim 'W Mā Malakat 'Aymānuhum Fa'innahum Ghayru Malūmīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [947]- Female slaves or captives under their ownership.

translations.english_saheeh: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,[947] for indeed, they will not be blamed -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except from their wives or (the slaves) that their right hands possess, - for then, they are free from blame;
translations.english_rwwad: except with their wives or slave women they may own, for then they are free of blame.

arabic_text: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ
phonetic: 23.7 Famani Abtaghá Warā'a Dhālika Fa'ūlā'ika Humu Al-`Ādūna

translations.english_saheeh: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -
translations.english_hilali_khan: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors;
translations.english_rwwad: But whoever seeks anything beyond that, it is they who are the transgressors.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ لِأَمَٰنَٰتِهِمۡ وَعَهۡدِهِمۡ رَٰعُونَ
phonetic: 23.8 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum Li'mānātihim Wa `Ahdihim Rā`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they who are to their trusts and their promises attentive
translations.english_hilali_khan: Those who are faithfully true to their Amanât (all the duties which Allâh has ordained, honesty, moral responsibility and trusts) and to their covenants;
translations.english_rwwad: And those who are faithful to their trusts and pledges,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَلَىٰ صَلَوَٰتِهِمۡ يُحَافِظُونَ
phonetic: 23.9 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum `Alá Şalawātihim Yuĥāfižūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they who carefully maintain their prayers -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who strictly guard their (five compulsory congregational) Salawât (prayers) (at their fixed stated hours).
translations.english_rwwad: and those who properly observe their prayers.

arabic_text: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡوَٰرِثُونَ
phonetic: 23.10 'Ūlā'ika Humu Al-Wārithūna

translations.english_saheeh: Those are the inheritors
translations.english_hilali_khan: These are indeed the inheritors
translations.english_rwwad: Such will be the inheritors,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ ٱلۡفِرۡدَوۡسَ هُمۡ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
phonetic: 23.11 Al-Ladhīna Yarithūna Al-Firdawsa Hum Fīhā Khālidūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [948]- The highest part of Paradise.

translations.english_saheeh: Who will inherit al-Firdaus.[948] They will abide therein eternally.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who shall inherit the Firdaus (Paradise). They shall dwell therein forever.
translations.english_rwwad: who will inherit Paradise; they will abide therein forever.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن سُلَٰلَةٖ مِّن طِينٖ
phonetic: 23.12 Wa Laqad Khalaqnā Al-'Insāna Min Sulālatin Min Ţīnin

translations.english_saheeh: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We created man (Adam) out of an extract of clay (water and earth).
translations.english_rwwad: We created man from an extract of clay,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ جَعَلۡنَٰهُ نُطۡفَةٗ فِي قَرَارٖ مَّكِينٖ
phonetic: 23.13 Thumma Ja`alnāhu Nuţfatan Fī Qarārin Makīnin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [949]- Or "as a zygote."

translations.english_saheeh: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop[949] in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thereafter We made him (the offspring of Adam) as a Nutfah (mixed drops of the male and female sexual discharge and lodged it) in a safe lodging (womb of the woman).
translations.english_rwwad: then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a safe place,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلنُّطۡفَةَ عَلَقَةٗ فَخَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡعَلَقَةَ مُضۡغَةٗ فَخَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡمُضۡغَةَ عِظَٰمٗا فَكَسَوۡنَا ٱلۡعِظَٰمَ لَحۡمٗا ثُمَّ أَنشَأۡنَٰهُ خَلۡقًا ءَاخَرَۚ فَتَبَارَكَ ٱللَّهُ أَحۡسَنُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقِينَ
phonetic: 23.14 Thumma Khalaqnā An-Nuţfata `Alaqatan Fakhalaqnā Al-`Alaqata Muđghatan Fakhalaqnā Al-Muđghata `Ižāmāan Fakasawnā Al-`Ižāma Laĥmāan Thumma 'Ansha'nāhu Khalqāan 'Ākhara Fatabāraka Allāhu 'Aĥsanu Al-Khāliqīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [950]- i.e., the most skillful and only true Creator.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allāh, the best of creators.[950]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We made the Nutfah into a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood), then We made the clot into a little lump of flesh, then We made out of that little lump of flesh bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh, and then We brought it forth as another creation. So Blessed is Allâh, the Best of creators.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, then We made the clinging clot into a lump, then We made the lump into bones, and We clothed the bones with flesh, and then We developed it into another creation. So Blessed is Allah, the Best of Creators.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم بَعۡدَ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَيِّتُونَ
phonetic: 23.15 Thumma 'Innakum Ba`da Dhālika Lamayyitūna

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed, after that you are to die.
translations.english_hilali_khan: After that, surely, you will die.
translations.english_rwwad: Then after that you will surely die,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ تُبۡعَثُونَ
phonetic: 23.16 Thumma 'Innakum Yawma Al-Qiyāmati Tub`athūna

translations.english_saheeh: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, will be resurrected.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then (again), surely, you will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection.
translations.english_rwwad: then on the Day of Resurrection you will surely be resurrected.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمۡ سَبۡعَ طَرَآئِقَ وَمَا كُنَّا عَنِ ٱلۡخَلۡقِ غَٰفِلِينَ
phonetic: 23.17 Wa Laqad Khalaqnā Fawqakum Sab`a Ţarā'iqa Wa Mā Kunnā `Ani Al-Khalqi Ghāfilīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We have created above you seven heavens (one over the other), and We are never unaware of the creation.
translations.english_rwwad: We have created above you seven levels [of heaven], and We have never been unaware of Our creation.

arabic_text: وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءَۢ بِقَدَرٖ فَأَسۡكَنَّٰهُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ ذَهَابِۭ بِهِۦ لَقَٰدِرُونَ
phonetic: 23.18 Wa 'Anzalnā Mina As-Samā'i Mā'an Biqadarin Fa'askannāhu Fī Al-'Arđi Wa 'Innā `Alá Dhahābin Bihi Laqādirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are Able to take it away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We sent down from the sky water (rain) in (due) measure, and We gave it lodging in the earth, and verily, We are Able to take it away.
translations.english_rwwad: We send down water from the sky in due measure and cause it to stay in the earth, and We are surely able to take it away.

arabic_text: فَأَنشَأۡنَا لَكُم بِهِۦ جَنَّٰتٖ مِّن نَّخِيلٖ وَأَعۡنَٰبٖ لَّكُمۡ فِيهَا فَوَٰكِهُ كَثِيرَةٞ وَمِنۡهَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
phonetic: 23.19 Fa'ansha'nā Lakum Bihi Jannātin Min Nakhīlin Wa 'A`nābin Lakum Fīhā Fawākihu Kathīratun Wa Minhā Ta'kulūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We brought forth for you therewith gardens of date-palms and grapes, wherein is much fruit for you, and whereof you eat.
translations.english_rwwad: With this [water] We produce for you gardens of palm trees and grapevines, in which there are many fruits from which you eat,

arabic_text: وَشَجَرَةٗ تَخۡرُجُ مِن طُورِ سَيۡنَآءَ تَنۢبُتُ بِٱلدُّهۡنِ وَصِبۡغٖ لِّلۡأٓكِلِينَ
phonetic: 23.20 Wa Shajaratan Takhruju Min Ţūri Saynā'a Tanbutu Bid-Duhni Wa Şibghin Lil'ākilīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food [i.e., olives] for those who eat.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And a tree (olive) that springs forth from Mount Sinai, that grows (produces) oil, and (it is a) relish for the eaters.
translations.english_rwwad: and [olive] tree that grows at Mount Sinai, producing oil and condiment for those who eat.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ لَكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَنۡعَٰمِ لَعِبۡرَةٗۖ نُّسۡقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِي بُطُونِهَا وَلَكُمۡ فِيهَا مَنَٰفِعُ كَثِيرَةٞ وَمِنۡهَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
phonetic: 23.21 Wa 'Inna Lakum Fī Al-'An`āmi La`ibratan Nusqīkum Mimmā Fī Buţūnihā Wa Lakum Fīhā Manāfi`u Kathīratun Wa Minhā Ta'kulūna

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily in the cattle there is indeed a lesson for you. We give you to drink (milk) of that which is in their bellies. And there are, in them, numerous (other) benefits for you, and of them you eat.
translations.english_rwwad: And there is certainly a lesson for you in livestock animals. We provide you with drink out of what they have in their bellies, and for you there are many benefits in them, and from their [meat] you eat,

arabic_text: وَعَلَيۡهَا وَعَلَى ٱلۡفُلۡكِ تُحۡمَلُونَ
phonetic: 23.22 Wa `Alayhā Wa `Alá Al-Fulki Tuĥmalūna

translations.english_saheeh: And upon them and on ships you are carried.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And on them, and on ships you are carried.
translations.english_rwwad: and on them and on boats you are carried.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦ فَقَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنۡ إِلَٰهٍ غَيۡرُهُۥٓۚ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
phonetic: 23.23 Wa Laqad 'Arsalnā Nūĥāan 'Ilá Qawmihi Faqāla Yā Qawmi A`budū Allāha Mā Lakum Min 'Ilahin Ghayruhu 'Afalā Tattaqūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We sent Nûh (Noah) to his people, and he said: "O my people! Worship Allâh! You have no other Ilâh (God) but Him (Islâmic Monotheism). Will you not then be afraid (of Him i.e. of His punishment because of worshipping others besides Him)?"
translations.english_rwwad: We sent Noah to his people. He said, “O my people, worship Allah; you have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear Him?”

arabic_text: فَقَالَ ٱلۡمَلَؤُاْ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن قَوۡمِهِۦ مَا هَٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُكُمۡ يُرِيدُ أَن يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ وَلَوۡ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَأَنزَلَ مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗ مَّا سَمِعۡنَا بِهَٰذَا فِيٓ ءَابَآئِنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
phonetic: 23.24 Faqāla Al-Mala'u Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Min Qawmihi Mā Hādhā 'Illā Basharun Mithlukum Yurīdu 'An Yatafađđala `Alaykum Wa Law Shā'a Allāhu La'anzala Malā'ikatan Mā Sami`nā Bihadhā Fī 'Ābā'inā Al-'Awwalīna

translations.english_saheeh: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allāh had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But the chiefs of his people who disbelieved said: "He is no more than a human being like you, he seeks to make himself superior to you. Had Allâh willed, He surely could have sent down angels. Never did we hear such a thing among our fathers of old.
translations.english_rwwad: The disbelieving chiefs of his people said, “This is only a man like yourselves who wants to be superior to you. If Allah had willed, He could have sent down angels. We have not heard such a thing from our forefathers.

arabic_text: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلُۢ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٞ فَتَرَبَّصُواْ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ
phonetic: 23.25 'In Huwa 'Illā Rajulun Bihi Jinnatun Fatarabbaşū Bihi Ĥattá Ĥīnin

translations.english_saheeh: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "He is only a man in whom is madness, so wait for him a while."
translations.english_rwwad: He is just a madman, so bear with him for a while.”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرۡنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
phonetic: 23.26 Qāla Rabbi Anşurnī Bimā Kadhabūni

translations.english_saheeh: [Noah] said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Nûh (Noah)] said: "O my Lord! Help me because they deny me."
translations.english_rwwad: Noah said, “My Lord, help me, for they have rejected me.”

arabic_text: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَيۡهِ أَنِ ٱصۡنَعِ ٱلۡفُلۡكَ بِأَعۡيُنِنَا وَوَحۡيِنَا فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَمۡرُنَا وَفَارَ ٱلتَّنُّورُ فَٱسۡلُكۡ فِيهَا مِن كُلّٖ زَوۡجَيۡنِ ٱثۡنَيۡنِ وَأَهۡلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ مِنۡهُمۡۖ وَلَا تُخَٰطِبۡنِي فِي ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ إِنَّهُم مُّغۡرَقُونَ
phonetic: 23.27 Fa'awĥaynā 'Ilayhi 'Ani Aşna`i Al-Fulka Bi'a`yuninā Wa Waĥyinā Fa'idhā Jā'a 'Amrunā Wa Fāra At-Tannūru Fāsluk Fīhā Min Kullin Zawjayni Athnayni Wa 'Ahlaka 'Illā Man Sabaqa `Alayhi Al-Qawlu Minhum Wa Lā Tukhāţibnī Fī Al-Ladhīna Žalamū 'Innahum Mughraqūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [951]- See footnote to 11:40.

translations.english_saheeh: So We inspired to him, "Construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows,[951] put into it [i.e., the ship] from each [creature] two mates and your family, except him for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We revealed to him (saying): "Construct the ship under Our Eyes and under Our Revelation (guidance). Then, when Our Command comes, and water gushes forth from the oven, take on board of each kind two (male and female), and your family, except those thereof against whom the Word has already gone forth. And address Me not in favour of those who have done wrong. Verily, they are to be drowned.
translations.english_rwwad: So We inspired him [saying], “Make the Ark under Our Eyes and according to Our directions. Then when Our command comes and the oven bursts with water, take on board a pair of each species and your family, except those against whom the decree has already been passed. And do not plead with Me concerning those who have done wrong, for they will surely be drowned.”

arabic_text: فَإِذَا ٱسۡتَوَيۡتَ أَنتَ وَمَن مَّعَكَ عَلَى ٱلۡفُلۡكِ فَقُلِ ٱلۡحَمۡدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِي نَجَّىٰنَا مِنَ ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 23.28 Fa'idhā Astawayta 'Anta Wa Man Ma`aka `Alá Al-Fulki Faquli Al-Ĥamdu Lillāhi Al-Ladhī Najjānā Mina Al-Qawmi Až-Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allāh who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when you have embarked on the ship, you and whoever is with you, then say: "All the praises and thanks be to Allâh, Who has saved us from the people who are Zâlimûn (i.e. oppressors, wrong-doers, polytheists, those who join others in worship with Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: Then when you and those who are with you have embarked on the Ark, say, “All praise is for Allah, Who saved us from the wrongdoing people.”

arabic_text: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَنزِلۡنِي مُنزَلٗا مُّبَارَكٗا وَأَنتَ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡمُنزِلِينَ
phonetic: 23.29 Wa Qul Rabbi 'Anzilnī Munzalāan Mubārakāan Wa 'Anta Khayru Al-Munzilīna

translations.english_saheeh: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].'"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And say: "My Lord! Cause me to land at a blessed landing-place, for You are the Best of those who bring to land."
translations.english_rwwad: And say: “My Lord, make my landing a blessed landing, for You provide the best landing’”.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَٰتٖ وَإِن كُنَّا لَمُبۡتَلِينَ
phonetic: 23.30 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyātin Wa 'In Kunnā Lamubtalīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, in this [what We did as regards drowning of the people of Nûh (Noah)], there are indeed Ayât (proofs, evidence, lessons, signs, etc. for men to understand), for sure We are ever putting (men) to the test.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there are signs in this, and We always put people to test.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَنشَأۡنَا مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِمۡ قَرۡنًا ءَاخَرِينَ
phonetic: 23.31 Thumma 'Ansha'nā Min Ba`dihim Qarnāan 'Ākharīna

translations.english_saheeh: Then We produced after them a generation of others.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, after them, We created another generation.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We raised up after them another generation,

arabic_text: فَأَرۡسَلۡنَا فِيهِمۡ رَسُولٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ أَنِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنۡ إِلَٰهٍ غَيۡرُهُۥٓۚ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
phonetic: 23.32 Fa'arsalnā Fīhim Rasūlāan Minhum 'Ani A`budū Allāha Mā Lakum Min 'Ilahin Ghayruhu 'Afalā Tattaqūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [952]- Prophet Hūd, who was sent to the tribe of ʿAad.

translations.english_saheeh: And We sent among them a messenger[952] from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We sent to them a Messenger from among themselves (saying): "Worship Allâh! You have no other Ilâh (God) but Him. Will you not then be afraid (of Him i.e. of His punishment because of worshipping others besides Him)?"
translations.english_rwwad: and We sent to them a messenger from among themselves [saying], “Worship Allah; you have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear Him?”

arabic_text: وَقَالَ ٱلۡمَلَأُ مِن قَوۡمِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَكَذَّبُواْ بِلِقَآءِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ وَأَتۡرَفۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا مَا هَٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُكُمۡ يَأۡكُلُ مِمَّا تَأۡكُلُونَ مِنۡهُ وَيَشۡرَبُ مِمَّا تَشۡرَبُونَ
phonetic: 23.33 Wa Qāla Al-Mala'u Min Qawmihi Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Wa Kadhabū Biliqā'i Al-'Ākhirati Wa 'Atrafnāhum Fī Al-Ĥayāati Ad-Dunyā Mā Hādhā 'Illā Basharun Mithlukum Ya'kulu Mimmā Ta'kulūna Minhu Wa Yashrabu Mimmā Tashrabūna

translations.english_saheeh: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and denied the Meeting in the Hereafter, and whom We had given the luxuries and comforts of this life, said: "He is no more than a human being like you, he eats of that which you eat, and drinks of what you drink.
translations.english_rwwad: But the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and whom We had made affluent in the life of this world, said, “He is no more than a man like yourselves; he eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.

arabic_text: وَلَئِنۡ أَطَعۡتُم بَشَرٗا مِّثۡلَكُمۡ إِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّخَٰسِرُونَ
phonetic: 23.34 Wa La'in 'Aţa`tum Basharāan Mithlakum 'Innakum 'Idhāan Lakhāsirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, then verily you indeed would be losers.
translations.english_rwwad: If you obey a man like yourselves, you will surely be losers.

arabic_text: أَيَعِدُكُمۡ أَنَّكُمۡ إِذَا مِتُّمۡ وَكُنتُمۡ تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَنَّكُم مُّخۡرَجُونَ
phonetic: 23.35 'Aya`idukum 'Annakum 'Idhā Mittum Wa Kuntum Turābāan Wa `Ižāmāan 'Annakum Mukhrajūna

translations.english_saheeh: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [once more]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Does he promise you that when you have died and have become dust and bones, you shall come out alive (resurrected)?
translations.english_rwwad: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones, that you will be brought forth?

arabic_text: ۞ هَيۡهَاتَ هَيۡهَاتَ لِمَا تُوعَدُونَ
phonetic: 23.36 Hayhāta Hayhāta Limā Tū`adūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [953]- i.e., how distant and improbable it is.

translations.english_saheeh: How far, how far, is that which you are promised.[953]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Far, very far is that which you are promised!
translations.english_rwwad: Far-fetched, utterly far-fetched is what you are promised!

arabic_text: إِنۡ هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا ٱلدُّنۡيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحۡيَا وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَبۡعُوثِينَ
phonetic: 23.37 'In Hiya 'Illā Ĥayātunā Ad-Dunyā Namūtu Wa Naĥyā Wa Mā Naĥnu Bimab`ūthīna

translations.english_saheeh: It [i.e., life] is not but our worldly life - we die and live, but we will not be resurrected.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "There is nothing but our life of this world! We die and we live! And we are not going to be resurrected!
translations.english_rwwad: There is nothing except our life of this world; we die, others are born, and none will be resurrected.

arabic_text: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ ٱفۡتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبٗا وَمَا نَحۡنُ لَهُۥ بِمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 23.38 'In Huwa 'Illā Rajulun Aftará `Alá Allāhi Kadhibāan Wa Mā Naĥnu Lahu Bimu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allāh, and we will not believe him."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "He is only a man who has invented a lie against Allâh, and we are not going to believe in him."
translations.english_rwwad: He is no more than a man who has fabricated lies about Allah, and we will never believe in him.”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرۡنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
phonetic: 23.39 Qāla Rabbi Anşurnī Bimā Kadhabūni

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "O my Lord! Help me because they deny me."
translations.english_rwwad: Noah said, “My Lord, help me for they have rejected me.”

arabic_text: قَالَ عَمَّا قَلِيلٖ لَّيُصۡبِحُنَّ نَٰدِمِينَ
phonetic: 23.40 Qāla `Ammā Qalīlin Layuşbiĥunna Nādimīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "After a little, they will surely become regretful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "In a little while, they are sure to be regretful."
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said, “In a little while they will surely be regretful.”

arabic_text: فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّيۡحَةُ بِٱلۡحَقِّ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُمۡ غُثَآءٗۚ فَبُعۡدٗا لِّلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 23.41 Fa'akhadhat/humu Aş-Şayĥatu Bil-Ĥaqqi Faja`alnāhum Ghuthā'an Fabu`dāan Lilqawmi Až-Žālimīna

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[954]- See footnote to 11:67.
[955]- i.e., by right or in justice.

translations.english_saheeh: So the shriek[954] seized them in truth,[955] and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So As-Saihah (torment - awful cry) overtook them in truth (with justice), and We made them as rubbish of dead plants. So away with the people who are Zâlimûn (polytheists, wrong-doers, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allâh, disobedient to His Messengers).
translations.english_rwwad: So the huge blast overtook them in all justice, and We swept them away like scum. So away with the wrongdoing people!

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَنشَأۡنَا مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِمۡ قُرُونًا ءَاخَرِينَ
phonetic: 23.42 Thumma 'Ansha'nā Min Ba`dihim Qurūnāan 'Ākharīna

translations.english_saheeh: Then We produced after them other generations.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, after them, We created other generations.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We raised after them other generations.

arabic_text: مَا تَسۡبِقُ مِنۡ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسۡتَـٔۡخِرُونَ
phonetic: 23.43 Mā Tasbiqu Min 'Ummatin 'Ajalahā Wa Mā Yasta'khirūna

translations.english_saheeh: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].
translations.english_hilali_khan: No nation can advance their term, nor can they delay it.
translations.english_rwwad: No nation can bring its appointed time forward, nor can they delay it.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَرۡسَلۡنَا رُسُلَنَا تَتۡرَاۖ كُلَّ مَا جَآءَ أُمَّةٗ رَّسُولُهَا كَذَّبُوهُۖ فَأَتۡبَعۡنَا بَعۡضَهُم بَعۡضٗا وَجَعَلۡنَٰهُمۡ أَحَادِيثَۚ فَبُعۡدٗا لِّقَوۡمٖ لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 23.44 Thumma 'Arsalnā Rusulanā Tatrā Kulla Mā Jā'a 'Ummatan Rasūluhā Kadhabūhu Fa'atba`nā Ba`đahum Ba`đāan Wa Ja`alnāhum 'Aĥādītha Fabu`dāan Liqawmin Lā Yu'uminūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [956]- i.e., history or lessons for mankind.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations.[956] So away with a people who do not believe.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation their Messenger, they denied him; so We made them follow one another (to destruction), and We made them as Ahadîth (the true stories for mankind to learn a lesson from them). So away with a people who believe not!
translations.english_rwwad: Then We sent Our messengers in succession: every time a messenger came to his people, they rejected him. So We destroyed them, one after the others, and made them mere tales. Away with the people who refuse to believe!

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَرۡسَلۡنَا مُوسَىٰ وَأَخَاهُ هَٰرُونَ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا وَسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٍ
phonetic: 23.45 Thumma 'Arsalnā Mūsá Wa 'Akhāhu Hārūna Bi'āyātinā Wa Sulţānin Mubīnin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [957]- i.e., evidences from Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority[957]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We sent Mûsa (Moses) and his brother Hârûn‎‎ (Aaron), with Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and manifest authority,
translations.english_rwwad: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and compelling proof

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَمَلَإِيْهِۦ فَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ وَكَانُواْ قَوۡمًا عَالِينَ
phonetic: 23.46 'Ilá Fir`awna Wa Mala'ihi Fāstakbarū Wa Kānū Qawmāan `Ālīna

translations.english_saheeh: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: To Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs, but they behaved insolently and they were people self-exalting (by disobeying their Lord, and exalting themselves over and above the Messenger of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they showed arrogance and were haughty people.

arabic_text: فَقَالُوٓاْ أَنُؤۡمِنُ لِبَشَرَيۡنِ مِثۡلِنَا وَقَوۡمُهُمَا لَنَا عَٰبِدُونَ
phonetic: 23.47 Faqālū 'Anu'uminu Libasharayni Mithlinā Wa Qawmuhumā Lanā `Ābidūna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves, and their people are obedient to us with humility (and we use them to serve us as we like)."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Should we believe in two men like ourselves, when their people are our slaves?”

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَكَانُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُهۡلَكِينَ
phonetic: 23.48 Fakadhabūhumā Fakānū Mina Al-Muhlakīna

translations.english_saheeh: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they denied them both [Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron)] and became of those who were destroyed.
translations.english_rwwad: So they rejected them both, and were among those who were destroyed.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَا مُوسَى ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَهۡتَدُونَ
phonetic: 23.49 Wa Laqad 'Ātaynā Mūsá Al-Kitāba La`allahum Yahtadūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [958]- The Children of Israel.

translations.english_saheeh: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they[958] would be guided.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We gave Mûsâ (Moses) the Scripture, that they may be guided.
translations.english_rwwad: We gave Moses the Scripture so that they might be guided.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱبۡنَ مَرۡيَمَ وَأُمَّهُۥٓ ءَايَةٗ وَءَاوَيۡنَٰهُمَآ إِلَىٰ رَبۡوَةٖ ذَاتِ قَرَارٖ وَمَعِينٖ
phonetic: 23.50 Wa Ja`alnā Abna Maryama Wa 'Ummahu 'Āyatan Wa 'Āwaynāhumā 'Ilá Rabwatin Dhāti Qarārin Wa Ma`īnin

translations.english_saheeh: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We made the son of Maryam (Mary) and his mother as a sign, and We gave them refuge on high ground, a place of rest, security and flowing streams.
translations.english_rwwad: We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and sheltered them on a hillside – a place of rest and a flowing stream.

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلرُّسُلُ كُلُواْ مِنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَٰتِ وَٱعۡمَلُواْ صَٰلِحًاۖ إِنِّي بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ عَلِيمٞ
phonetic: 23.51 Yā 'Ayyuhā Ar-Rusulu Kulū Mina Aţ-Ţayyibāti Wa A`malū Şāliĥāan 'Innī Bimā Ta`malūna `Alīmun

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh said], "O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Knowing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: O (you) Messengers! Eat of the Tayyibât [all kinds of Halâl foods which Allâh has made lawful (meat of slaughtered eatable animals, milk products, fats, vegetables, fruits, etc.] and do righteous deeds. Verily! I am Well-Acquainted with what you do.
translations.english_rwwad: O messengers, eat from the lawful things and act righteously, for I am All-Knowing of what you do.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦٓ أُمَّتُكُمۡ أُمَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ وَأَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمۡ فَٱتَّقُونِ
phonetic: 23.52 Wa 'Inna Hadhihi 'Ummatukum 'Ummatan Wāĥidatan Wa 'Anā Rabbukum Fa Attaqūni

footnotes.english_saheeh: [959]- See footnote to 21:92.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion,[959] and I am your Lord, so fear Me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily this your religion (of Islâmic Monotheism) is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear (keep your duty to) Me.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this religion of yours is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me.

arabic_text: فَتَقَطَّعُوٓاْ أَمۡرَهُم بَيۡنَهُمۡ زُبُرٗاۖ كُلُّ حِزۡبِۭ بِمَا لَدَيۡهِمۡ فَرِحُونَ
phonetic: 23.53 Fataqaţţa`ū 'Amrahum Baynahum Zuburāan Kullu Ĥizbin Bimā Ladayhim Fariĥūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [960]- Of beliefs, opinions, customs, etc.

translations.english_saheeh: But they [i.e., the people] divided their religion among them into portions [i.e., sects] - each faction, in what it has,[960] rejoicing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they (men) have broken their religion among them into sects,[1] each group rejoicing in what is with it (as its beliefs).
translations.english_rwwad: But people split up their religion into factions, each faction rejoicing in what it has.

arabic_text: فَذَرۡهُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَتِهِمۡ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
phonetic: 23.54 Fadharhum Fī Ghamratihim Ĥattá Ĥīnin

translations.english_saheeh: So leave them in their confusion for a time.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So leave them in their error for a time.
translations.english_rwwad: So leave them in their heedlessness for a while.

arabic_text: أَيَحۡسَبُونَ أَنَّمَا نُمِدُّهُم بِهِۦ مِن مَّالٖ وَبَنِينَ
phonetic: 23.55 'Ayaĥsabūna 'Annamā Numidduhum Bihi Min Mālin Wa Banīna

translations.english_saheeh: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children
translations.english_hilali_khan: Do they think that in wealth and children with which We enlarge them
translations.english_rwwad: Do they think that what We give them wealth and children,

arabic_text: نُسَارِعُ لَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡخَيۡرَٰتِۚ بَل لَّا يَشۡعُرُونَ
phonetic: 23.56 Nusāri`u Lahum Fī Al-Khayrāti Bal Lā Yash`urūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [961]- That the good things given to them in this world are but a trial for them.

translations.english_saheeh: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.[961]
translations.english_hilali_khan: We hasten unto them with good things. Nay, [it is a Fitnah (trial) in this worldly life so that they will have no share of good things in the Hereafter] but they perceive not. [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi].
translations.english_rwwad: that We hasten to them all that is good? No, but they do not perceive it.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ خَشۡيَةِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ
phonetic: 23.57 'Inna Al-Ladhīna Hum Min Khashyati Rabbihim Mushfiqūna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily those who live in awe for fear of their Lord;
translations.english_rwwad: Those who are in awe for fearful of their Lord,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ يُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 23.58 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum Bi'āyāti Rabbihim Yu'uminūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who believe in the Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of their Lord;
translations.english_rwwad: and those who believe in the verses of their Lord,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِرَبِّهِمۡ لَا يُشۡرِكُونَ
phonetic: 23.59 Wa Al-Ladhīna Hum Birabbihim Lā Yushrikūna

translations.english_saheeh: And they who do not associate anything with their Lord
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who join not anyone (in worship) as partners with their Lord;
translations.english_rwwad: and those who do not associate partners with their Lord,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُؤۡتُونَ مَآ ءَاتَواْ وَّقُلُوبُهُمۡ وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمۡ رَٰجِعُونَ
phonetic: 23.60 Wa Al-Ladhīna Yu'utūna Mā 'Ātaw Wa Qulūbuhum Wa Jilatun 'Annahum 'Ilá Rabbihim Rāji`ūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [962]- Lest their deeds not be acceptable.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.23:60) Narrated ‘Âishah رضي الله عنها (the wife of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم), I asked Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم about this (following Verse): "And those who give that (their charity) which they give (and also do other good deeds) with their hearts full of fear ..." (V.23:60).
She added: "Are these who drink alcoholic drinks and steal?" Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم replied: "No! O the daughter of As-Siddîq, but they are those who fast, pray, and practise charity and they are afraid that (their good) deeds may not be accepted (by Allâh) from them. ‘It is these who hasten in good deeds.’ " (Sunan At-Tirmidhi Hadith No.3225), (Tafsîr Al-Qurtubî).

translations.english_saheeh: And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful[962] because they will be returning to their Lord -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who give that (their charity) which they give (and also do other good deeds) with their hearts full of fear (whether their alms and charities have been accepted or not),[1] because they are sure to return to their Lord (for reckoning).
translations.english_rwwad: and those who do whatever [good] they do with their hearts fearful, knowing that they will return to their Lord –

arabic_text: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ يُسَٰرِعُونَ فِي ٱلۡخَيۡرَٰتِ وَهُمۡ لَهَا سَٰبِقُونَ
phonetic: 23.61 'Ūlā'ika Yusāri`ūna Fī Al-Khayrāti Wa Hum Lahā Sābiqūna

translations.english_saheeh: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It is these who hasten in the good deeds, and they are foremost in them [e.g. offering the compulsory Salât (prayers) in their (early) stated, fixed times and so on].
translations.english_rwwad: it is they who hasten to do good deeds, and they are foremost in them.

arabic_text: وَلَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفۡسًا إِلَّا وُسۡعَهَاۚ وَلَدَيۡنَا كِتَٰبٞ يَنطِقُ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَهُمۡ لَا يُظۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 23.62 Wa Lā Nukallifu Nafsāan 'Illā Wus`ahā Wa Ladaynā Kitābun Yanţiqu Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa Hum Lā Yužlamūn

translations.english_saheeh: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We task not any person except according to his capacity, and with Us is a Record which speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged.
translations.english_rwwad: We do not burden a soul more than what it can bear. We have a Record [of their deeds] that tells the truth, and none will be wronged.

arabic_text: بَلۡ قُلُوبُهُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَةٖ مِّنۡ هَٰذَا وَلَهُمۡ أَعۡمَٰلٞ مِّن دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ هُمۡ لَهَا عَٰمِلُونَ
phonetic: 23.63 Bal Qulūbuhum Fī Ghamratin Min Hādhā Wa Lahum 'A`mālun Min Dūni Dhālika Hum Lahā `Āmilūna

translations.english_saheeh: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides that [i.e., disbelief] which they are doing,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, but their hearts are covered from (understanding) this (the Qur’ân), and they have other (evil) deeds, besides, which they are doing.
translations.english_rwwad: But their hearts are oblivious of this [Qur’an], and they have other [evil] deeds that they are doing.

arabic_text: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذۡنَا مُتۡرَفِيهِم بِٱلۡعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمۡ يَجۡـَٔرُونَ
phonetic: 23.64 Ĥattá 'Idhā 'Akhadhnā Mutrafīhim Bil-`Adhābi 'Idhā Hum Yaj'arūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [963]- In worldly life, before the punishment of the Hereafter.  Although general, the description includes specifically the punishment of the Quraysh by famine.

translations.english_saheeh: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment,[963] at once they are crying [to Allāh] for help.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Until when We seize those of them who lead a luxurious life with punishment: behold they make humble invocation with a loud voice.
translations.english_rwwad: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, they start crying for help.

arabic_text: لَا تَجۡـَٔرُواْ ٱلۡيَوۡمَۖ إِنَّكُم مِّنَّا لَا تُنصَرُونَ
phonetic: 23.65 Lā Taj'arū Al-Yawma 'Innakum Minnā Lā Tunşarūna

translations.english_saheeh: Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Invoke not loudly this day! Certainly you shall not be helped by Us.
translations.english_rwwad: “Do not cry for help today, for you will receive no help from Us.

arabic_text: قَدۡ كَانَتۡ ءَايَٰتِي تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡكُمۡ فَكُنتُمۡ عَلَىٰٓ أَعۡقَٰبِكُمۡ تَنكِصُونَ
phonetic: 23.66 Qad Kānat 'Āyātī Tutlá `Alaykum Fakuntum `Alá 'A`qābikum Tankişūna

translations.english_saheeh: My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed My Verses used to be recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels (denying them, and refusing with hatred to listen to them).
translations.english_rwwad: My verses were recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels,

arabic_text: مُسۡتَكۡبِرِينَ بِهِۦ سَٰمِرٗا تَهۡجُرُونَ
phonetic: 23.67 Mustakbirīna Bihi Sāmirāan Tahjurūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [964]- The revelation.  Or "him," i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ).

translations.english_saheeh: In arrogance regarding it,[964] conversing by night, speaking evil.
translations.english_hilali_khan: In pride (they - Quraish pagans and polytheists of Makkah used to feel proud that they are the dwellers of Makkah sanctuary - Haram), talking evil about it (the Qur’ân) by night.
translations.english_rwwad: feeling proud of this [Sacred House], spending night in evil talks [about the Qur’an].”

arabic_text: أَفَلَمۡ يَدَّبَّرُواْ ٱلۡقَوۡلَ أَمۡ جَآءَهُم مَّا لَمۡ يَأۡتِ ءَابَآءَهُمُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
phonetic: 23.68 'Afalam Yaddabbarū Al-Qawla 'Am Jā'ahum Mā Lam Ya'ti 'Ābā'ahumu Al-'Awwalīna

translations.english_saheeh: Then have they not reflected over the word [i.e., the Qur’ān], or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have they not pondered over the Word (of Allâh, i.e. what is sent down to the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم), or has there come to them what had not come to their fathers of old?
translations.english_rwwad: Have they not pondered the Words [of Allah], or has there come to them what did not come to their forefathers?

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَمۡ يَعۡرِفُواْ رَسُولَهُمۡ فَهُمۡ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ
phonetic: 23.69 'Am Lam Ya`rifū Rasūlahum Fahum Lahu Munkirūna

translations.english_saheeh: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or is it that they did not recognize their Messenger (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) so they deny him?
translations.english_rwwad: Or is it that they do not recognize their Messenger, so they deny him?

arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ بِهِۦ جِنَّةُۢۚ بَلۡ جَآءَهُم بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَأَكۡثَرُهُمۡ لِلۡحَقِّ كَٰرِهُونَ
phonetic: 23.70 'Am Yaqūlūna Bihi Jinnatun Bal Jā'ahum Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa 'Aktharuhum Lilĥaqqi Kārihūna

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they say, "In him is madness"? Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or say they: There is madness in him? Nay, but he brought them the truth [i.e. Tauhîd: Worshipping Allâh Alone in all aspects, the Qur’ân and the religion of Islâm], but most of them (the disbelievers) are averse to the truth.
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they say, “There is madness in him?” Rather, he has come to them with the truth, but most of them are averse to the truth.

arabic_text: وَلَوِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلۡحَقُّ أَهۡوَآءَهُمۡ لَفَسَدَتِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتُ وَٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَمَن فِيهِنَّۚ بَلۡ أَتَيۡنَٰهُم بِذِكۡرِهِمۡ فَهُمۡ عَن ذِكۡرِهِم مُّعۡرِضُونَ
phonetic: 23.71 Wa Lawi Attaba`a Al-Ĥaqqu 'Ahwā'ahum Lafasadati As-Samāwātu Wa Al-'Arđu Wa Man Fīhinna Bal 'Ataynāhum Bidhikrihim Fahum `An Dhikrihim Mu`riđūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [965]- Or "reminder."

translations.english_saheeh: But if the Truth [i.e., Allāh] had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message,[965] but they, from their message, are turning away.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if the truth had been in accordance with their desires, verily, the heavens and the earth, and whosoever is therein would have been corrupted! Nay, We have brought them their reminder, but they turn away from their reminder.
translations.english_rwwad: Were the Truth to follow their desires, the heavens and earth, and all those who are therein would have been ruined. In fact, We have given them their Reminder, but they are averse to their Reminder.

arabic_text: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ خَرۡجٗا فَخَرَاجُ رَبِّكَ خَيۡرٞۖ وَهُوَ خَيۡرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
phonetic: 23.72 'Am Tas'aluhum Kharjāan Fakharāju Rabbika Khayrun Wa Huwa Khayru Ar-Rāziqīna

translations.english_saheeh: Or do you, [O Muḥammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or is it that you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) ask them for some wages? But the recompense of your Lord is better, and He is the Best of those who give sustenance.
translations.english_rwwad: Or do you ask them for some reward? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the Best of Providers.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّكَ لَتَدۡعُوهُمۡ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٖ مُّسۡتَقِيمٖ
phonetic: 23.73 Wa 'Innaka Latad`ūhum 'Ilá Şirāţin Mustaqīmin

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And certainly, you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) call them to the Straight Path (true religion - Islâmic Monotheism).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, you are calling them to a straight path,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ عَنِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ لَنَٰكِبُونَ
phonetic: 23.74 Wa 'Inna Al-Ladhīna Lā Yu'uminūna Bil-'Ākhirati `Ani Aş-Şirāţi Lanākibūna

translations.english_saheeh: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter are indeed deviating far astray from the Path (true religion - Islâmic Monotheism).
translations.english_rwwad: but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from that path.

arabic_text: ۞ وَلَوۡ رَحِمۡنَٰهُمۡ وَكَشَفۡنَا مَا بِهِم مِّن ضُرّٖ لَّلَجُّواْ فِي طُغۡيَٰنِهِمۡ يَعۡمَهُونَ
phonetic: 23.75 Wa Law Raĥimnāhum Wa Kashafnā Mā Bihim Min Đurrin Lalajjū Fī Ţughyānihim Ya`mahūna

translations.english_saheeh: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And though We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is on them, still they would obstinately persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
translations.english_rwwad: Even if We were to show them mercy and relieve their adversity, they would still persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَخَذۡنَٰهُم بِٱلۡعَذَابِ فَمَا ٱسۡتَكَانُواْ لِرَبِّهِمۡ وَمَا يَتَضَرَّعُونَ
phonetic: 23.76 Wa Laqad 'Akhadhnāhum Bil-`Adhābi Famā Astakānū Lirabbihim Wa Mā Yatađarra`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We seized them with punishment, but they humbled not themselves to their Lord, nor did they invoke (Allâh) with submission to Him.
translations.english_rwwad: We have already seized them with punishment, but they did not humble themselves to their Lord, nor did they supplicate in humility,

arabic_text: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فَتَحۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم بَابٗا ذَا عَذَابٖ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمۡ فِيهِ مُبۡلِسُونَ
phonetic: 23.77 Ĥattá 'Idhā Fataĥnā `Alayhim Bābāan Dhā `Adhābin Shadīdin 'Idhā Hum Fīhi Mublisūna

translations.english_saheeh: Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Until, when We open for them the gate of severe punishment, then lo! they will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair.
translations.english_rwwad: until when We open for them a gateway of a severe punishment, they will be plunged into utter despair.

arabic_text: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنشَأَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرَ وَٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةَۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَشۡكُرُونَ
phonetic: 23.78 Wa Huwa Al-Ladhī 'Ansha'a Lakumu As-Sam`a Wa Al-'Abşāra Wa Al-'Af'idata Qalīlāan Mā Tashkurūna

translations.english_saheeh: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It is He Who has created for you (the sense of) hearing (ears), eyes (sight), and hearts (understanding). Little thanks you give.
translations.english_rwwad: It is He Who gave you hearing, sight and hearts. How little you give thanks!

arabic_text: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِلَيۡهِ تُحۡشَرُونَ
phonetic: 23.79 Wa Huwa Al-Ladhī Dhara'akum Fī Al-'Arđi Wa 'Ilayhi Tuĥsharūna

translations.english_saheeh: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And it is He Who has created you on the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered back.
translations.english_rwwad: And it is He Who spread you on earth, and to Him you will all be gathered.

arabic_text: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي يُحۡيِۦ وَيُمِيتُ وَلَهُ ٱخۡتِلَٰفُ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِۚ أَفَلَا تَعۡقِلُونَ
phonetic: 23.80 Wa Huwa Al-Ladhī Yuĥyī Wa Yumītu Wa Lahu Akhtilāfu Al-Layli Wa An-Nahāri 'Afalā Ta`qilūna

translations.english_saheeh: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And it is He Who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of night and day. Will you not then understand?
translations.english_rwwad: It is He Who gives life and causes death, and to Him belongs the alternation of night and day. Do you not understand?

arabic_text: بَلۡ قَالُواْ مِثۡلَ مَا قَالَ ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ
phonetic: 23.81 Bal Qālū Mithla Mā Qāla Al-'Awwalūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [966]- Instead of understanding or reasoning.

translations.english_saheeh: Rather,[966] they say like what the former peoples said.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, but they say the like of what the men of old said.
translations.english_rwwad: But they say the like of what the earlier peoples said.

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ
phonetic: 23.82 Qālū 'A'idhā Mitnā Wa Kunnā Turābāan Wa `Ižāmāan 'A'innā Lamab`ūthūna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected indeed?
translations.english_rwwad: They say, “Is it that when we die and become dust and bones, will we really be resurrected?

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ وُعِدۡنَا نَحۡنُ وَءَابَآؤُنَا هَٰذَا مِن قَبۡلُ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
phonetic: 23.83 Laqad Wu`idnā Naĥnu Wa 'Ābā'uunā Hādhā Min Qablu 'In Hādhā 'Illā 'Asāţīru Al-'Awwalīna

translations.english_saheeh: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily, this we have been promised - we and our fathers before (us)! This is only the tales of the ancients!"
translations.english_rwwad: This is what we and our forefathers were promised before; this is nothing but ancient fables.”

arabic_text: قُل لِّمَنِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَمَن فِيهَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 23.84 Qul Limani Al-'Arđu Wa Man Fīhā 'In Kuntum Ta`lamūna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, [O Muḥammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say: "Whose is the earth and whosoever is therein? If you know!"
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “To whom belong the earth and all those who are on it, if you really know?”

arabic_text: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِۚ قُلۡ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
phonetic: 23.85 Sayaqūlūna Lillāhi Qul 'Afalā Tadhakkarūna

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "To Allāh." Say, "Then will you not remember?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "It is Allâh’s!" Say: "Will you not then remember?"
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “To Allah.” Say, “Will you not then take heed?”

arabic_text: قُلۡ مَن رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ ٱلسَّبۡعِ وَرَبُّ ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
phonetic: 23.86 Qul Man Rabbu As-Samāwāti As-Sab`i Wa Rabbu Al-`Arshi Al-`Ažīmi

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say: "Who is (the) Lord of the seven heavens, and (the) Lord of the Great Throne?"
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Mighty Throne?”

arabic_text: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِۚ قُلۡ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
phonetic: 23.87 Sayaqūlūna Lillāhi Qul 'Afalā Tattaqūna

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "[They belong] to Allāh." Say, "Then will you not fear Him?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "Allâh." Say: "Will you not then fear Allâh (believe in His Oneness, obey Him, believe in the Resurrection and Recompense for every good or bad deed)?"
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Allah.” Say, “Will you not then fear Him?”

arabic_text: قُلۡ مَنۢ بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ وَهُوَ يُجِيرُ وَلَا يُجَارُ عَلَيۡهِ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 23.88 Qul Man Biyadihi Malakūtu Kulli Shay'in Wa Huwa Yujīru Wa Lā Yujāru `Alayhi 'In Kuntum Ta`lamūn

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say "In Whose Hand is the sovereignty of everything (i.e. treasures of each and everything)? And He protects (all), while against Whom there is no protector, (i.e. if Allâh saves anyone none can punish or harm him, and if Allâh punishes or harms anyone none can save him), if you know?" [Tafsir Al-Qurtubî]
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “In Whose Hand is the dominion of all things – and He gives protection while none can protect against Him – if you really know?”

arabic_text: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِۚ قُلۡ فَأَنَّىٰ تُسۡحَرُونَ
phonetic: 23.89 Sayaqūlūna Lillāhi Qul Fa'annā Tusĥarūna

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "[All belongs] to Allāh." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "(All that belongs) to Allâh." Say: "How then are you deceived and turn away from the truth?"
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Allah.” Say, “Then how can you be deluded?”

arabic_text: بَلۡ أَتَيۡنَٰهُم بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَإِنَّهُمۡ لَكَٰذِبُونَ
phonetic: 23.90 Bal 'Ataynāhum Bil-Ĥaqqi Wa 'Innahum Lakādhibūna

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, but We have brought them the truth (Islâmic Monotheism), and verily, they (disbelievers) are liars.
translations.english_rwwad: In fact, We brought them the truth, but they are certainly liars.

arabic_text: مَا ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ مِن وَلَدٖ وَمَا كَانَ مَعَهُۥ مِنۡ إِلَٰهٍۚ إِذٗا لَّذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلَٰهِۭ بِمَا خَلَقَ وَلَعَلَا بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖۚ سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
phonetic: 23.91 Mā Attakhadha Allāhu Min Waladin Wa Mā Kāna Ma`ahu Min 'Ilahin 'Idhāan Ladhahaba Kullu 'Ilahin Bimā Khalaqa Wa La`alā Ba`đuhum `Alá Ba`đin Subĥāna Allāhi `Ammā Yaşifūna

translations.english_saheeh: Allāh has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have [sought to] overcome others. Exalted is Allāh above what they describe [concerning Him].
translations.english_hilali_khan: No son (or offspring) did Allâh beget, nor is there any ilâh (god) along with Him. (If there had been many gods), then each god would have taken away what he had created, and some would have tried to overcome others! Glorified be Allâh above all that they attribute to Him!
translations.english_rwwad: Allah has never begotten a son, nor is there any god besides Him. Otherwise, each god would have taken away what he had created, and each would have tried to gain supremacy over the other. Glory be to Allah far above what they ascribe to Him!

arabic_text: عَٰلِمِ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ وَٱلشَّهَٰدَةِ فَتَعَٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشۡرِكُونَ
phonetic: 23.92 `Ālimi Al-Ghaybi Wa Ash-Shahādati Fata`ālá `Ammā Yushrikūna

translations.english_saheeh: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above what they associate [with Him].
translations.english_hilali_khan: All-Knower of the unseen and the seen! Exalted be He over all that they associate as partners to Him!
translations.english_rwwad: Knower of the unseen and the seen. Exalted is He far above what they associate with Him!

arabic_text: قُل رَّبِّ إِمَّا تُرِيَنِّي مَا يُوعَدُونَ
phonetic: 23.93 Qul Rabbi 'Immā Turiyannī Mā Yū`adūna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, [O Muḥammad], "My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "My Lord! If You would show me that with which they are threatened (torment),
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “My Lord, if You show me what they are warned of,

arabic_text: رَبِّ فَلَا تَجۡعَلۡنِي فِي ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 23.94 Rabbi Falā Taj`alnī Fī Al-Qawmi Až-Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "My Lord! Then (save me from Your punishment), put me not amongst the people who are the Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers)."
translations.english_rwwad: my Lord, then do not include me among the wrongdoing people.”

arabic_text: وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّرِيَكَ مَا نَعِدُهُمۡ لَقَٰدِرُونَ
phonetic: 23.95 Wa 'Innā `Alá 'An Nuriyaka Mā Na`iduhum Laqādirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, We are Able to show you what We have promised them.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We are Able to show you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) that with which We have threatened them.
translations.english_rwwad: We are surely able to show you that of which We have warned them.

arabic_text: ٱدۡفَعۡ بِٱلَّتِي هِيَ أَحۡسَنُ ٱلسَّيِّئَةَۚ نَحۡنُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يَصِفُونَ
phonetic: 23.96 Adfa` Bi-Atī Hiya 'Aĥsanu As-Sayyi'ata Naĥnu 'A`lamu Bimā Yaşifūna

translations.english_saheeh: Repel, by [means of] what is best, [their] evil. We are most knowing of what they describe.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Repel evil with that which is better. We are Best-Acquainted with the things they utter.
translations.english_rwwad: Repel evil with what is best; We know well what they claim.

arabic_text: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنۡ هَمَزَٰتِ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينِ
phonetic: 23.97 Wa Qul Rabbi 'A`ūdhu Bika Min Hamazāti Ash-Shayāţīni

translations.english_saheeh: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And say: "My Lord! I seek refuge with You from the whisperings (suggestions) of the Shayâtîn (devils).
translations.english_rwwad: And say, “My Lord, I seek refuge with You from the temptations of the devils.

arabic_text: وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَن يَحۡضُرُونِ
phonetic: 23.98 Wa 'A`ūdhu Bika Rabbi 'An Yaĥđurūni

translations.english_saheeh: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And I seek refuge with You, My Lord! lest they should come near me."
translations.english_rwwad: And I seek refuge with You, my Lord, that they even come near me.”

arabic_text: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَحَدَهُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتُ قَالَ رَبِّ ٱرۡجِعُونِ
phonetic: 23.99 Ĥattá 'Idhā Jā'a 'Aĥadahumu Al-Mawtu Qāla Rabbi Arji`ūni

translations.english_saheeh: [For such is the state of the disbelievers] until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back
translations.english_hilali_khan: Until, when death comes to one of them (those who join partners with Allâh), he says: "My Lord! Send me back,
translations.english_rwwad: Until when death comes to one of them, he says, “My Lord, send me back,

arabic_text: لَعَلِّيٓ أَعۡمَلُ صَٰلِحٗا فِيمَا تَرَكۡتُۚ كـَلَّآۚ إِنَّهَا كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قَآئِلُهَاۖ وَمِن وَرَآئِهِم بَرۡزَخٌ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ
phonetic: 23.100 La`allī 'A`malu Şāliĥāan Fīmā Taraktu Kallā 'Innahā Kalimatun Huwa Qā'iluhā Wa Min Warā'ihim Barzakhun 'Ilá Yawmi Yub`athūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [967]- Or "in that which I neglected."

translations.english_saheeh: That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind."[967] No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So that I may do good in that which I have left behind!" No! It is but a word that he speaks; and behind them is Barzakh (a barrier) until the Day when they will be resurrected.
translations.english_rwwad: so that I may do righteous deeds in what I left behind.” No, it is only a word he utters. And behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَلَآ أَنسَابَ بَيۡنَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ وَلَا يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
phonetic: 23.101 Fa'idhā Nufikha Fī Aş-Şūri Falā 'Ansāba Baynahum Yawma'idhin Wa Lā Yatasā'alūna

translations.english_saheeh: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask of one another.
translations.english_rwwad: When the Trumpet is blown, there will be no kinship ties between them on that Day, nor will they ask about one another.

arabic_text: فَمَن ثَقُلَتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡمُفۡلِحُونَ
phonetic: 23.102 Faman Thaqulat Mawāzīnuhu Fa'ūlā'ika Humu Al-Mufliĥūna

translations.english_saheeh: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the successful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, those whose scales (of good deeds) are heavy, they are the successful.
translations.english_rwwad: So those whose scales [of good deeds] are heavy, it is they who will be successful.

arabic_text: وَمَنۡ خَفَّتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓاْ أَنفُسَهُمۡ فِي جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدُونَ
phonetic: 23.103 Wa Man Khaffat Mawāzīnuhu Fa'ūlā'ika Al-Ladhīna Khasirū 'Anfusahum Fī Jahannama Khālidūna

translations.english_saheeh: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those whose scales (of good deeds) are light, they are those who lose their ownselves, in Hell will they abide.
translations.english_rwwad: But those whose scales are light, they are the ones who have lost their souls, abiding in Hell forever.

arabic_text: تَلۡفَحُ وُجُوهَهُمُ ٱلنَّارُ وَهُمۡ فِيهَا كَٰلِحُونَ
phonetic: 23.104 Talfaĥu Wujūhahumu An-Nāru Wa Hum Fīhā Kāliĥūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [968]- Their lips having been contracted by scorching until the teeth are exposed.

translations.english_saheeh: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.[968]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Fire will burn their faces, and therein they will grin, with displaced lips (disfigured).
translations.english_rwwad: The Fire will scorch their faces, leaving them disfigured.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَكُنۡ ءَايَٰتِي تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡكُمۡ فَكُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
phonetic: 23.105 'Alam Takun 'Āyātī Tutlá `Alaykum Fakuntum Bihā Tukadhibūna

translations.english_saheeh: [It will be said], "Were not My verses recited to you and you used to deny them?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Were not My Verses (this Qur’ân) recited to you, and then you used to deny them?"
translations.english_rwwad: “Were not My verses recited to you, and you used to reject them?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ رَبَّنَا غَلَبَتۡ عَلَيۡنَا شِقۡوَتُنَا وَكُنَّا قَوۡمٗا ضَآلِّينَ
phonetic: 23.106 Qālū Rabbanā Ghalabat `Alaynā Shiqwatunā Wa Kunnā Qawmāan Đāllīna

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "Our Lord! Our wretchedness overcame us, and we were (an) erring people.
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Our Lord, our misfortune overwhelmed us, and we were a people who went astray.

arabic_text: رَبَّنَآ أَخۡرِجۡنَا مِنۡهَا فَإِنۡ عُدۡنَا فَإِنَّا ظَٰلِمُونَ
phonetic: 23.107 Rabbanā 'Akhrijnā Minhā Fa'in `Udnā Fa'innā Žālimūna

translations.english_saheeh: Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed be wrongdoers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Our Lord! Bring us out of this. If ever we return (to evil), then indeed we shall be Zâlimûn: (polytheists, oppressors, unjust, and wrong-doers)."
translations.english_rwwad: Our Lord, take us out of this; if we ever return, we will certainly be wrongdoers.”

arabic_text: قَالَ ٱخۡسَـُٔواْ فِيهَا وَلَا تُكَلِّمُونِ
phonetic: 23.108 Qāla Akhsa'ū Fīhā Wa Lā Tukallimūni

translations.english_saheeh: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He (Allâh) will say: "Remain you in it with ignominy! And speak you not to Me!"
translations.english_rwwad: Allah will say, “Stay therein despised, and do not speak to Me.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فَرِيقٞ مِّنۡ عِبَادِي يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ ءَامَنَّا فَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا وَٱرۡحَمۡنَا وَأَنتَ خَيۡرُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
phonetic: 23.109 'Innahu Kāna Farīqun Min `Ibādī Yaqūlūna Rabbanā 'Āmannā Fāghfir Lanā Wa Arĥamnā Wa 'Anta Khayru Ar-Rāĥimīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily there was a party of My slaves, who used to say: "Our Lord! We believe, so forgive us, and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of all who show mercy!"
translations.english_rwwad: There was a group of My slaves who used to pray, ‘Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.’

arabic_text: فَٱتَّخَذۡتُمُوهُمۡ سِخۡرِيًّا حَتَّىٰٓ أَنسَوۡكُمۡ ذِكۡرِي وَكُنتُم مِّنۡهُمۡ تَضۡحَكُونَ
phonetic: 23.110 Fāttakhadhtumūhum Sikhrīyāan Ĥattá 'Ansawkum Dhikrī Wa Kuntum Minhum Tađĥakūna

translations.english_saheeh: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But you took them for a laughing stock, so much so that they made you forget My Remembrance while you used to laugh at them!
translations.english_rwwad: But you took them in mockery until they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.

arabic_text: إِنِّي جَزَيۡتُهُمُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ بِمَا صَبَرُوٓاْ أَنَّهُمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡفَآئِزُونَ
phonetic: 23.111 'Innī Jazaytuhumu Al-Yawma Bimā Şabarū 'Annahum Humu Al-Fā'izūna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily I have rewarded them this Day for their patience: they are indeed the ones that are successful.
translations.english_rwwad: I have rewarded them Today for their patience; it is they who are the successful.”

arabic_text: قَٰلَ كَمۡ لَبِثۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ عَدَدَ سِنِينَ
phonetic: 23.112 Qāla Kam Labithtum Fī Al-'Arđi `Adada Sinīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] will say, "How long did you remain on earth in number of years?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: He (Allâh) will say: "What number of years did you stay on earth?"
translations.english_rwwad: He will say, “How many years did you stay on earth?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَبِثۡنَا يَوۡمًا أَوۡ بَعۡضَ يَوۡمٖ فَسۡـَٔلِ ٱلۡعَآدِّينَ
phonetic: 23.113 Qālū Labithnā Yawmāan 'Aw Ba`đa Yawmin Fās'ali Al-`Āddīna

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep account."
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “We stayed for a day or part of a day; ask those who keep count.”

arabic_text: قَٰلَ إِن لَّبِثۡتُمۡ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗاۖ لَّوۡ أَنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 23.114 Qāla 'In Labithtum 'Illā Qalīlāan Law 'Annakum Kuntum Ta`lamūna

translations.english_saheeh: He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He (Allâh) will say: "You stayed not but a little, if you had only known!
translations.english_rwwad: Allah will say, “You only stayed for a while, if only you had known.

arabic_text: أَفَحَسِبۡتُمۡ أَنَّمَا خَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ عَبَثٗا وَأَنَّكُمۡ إِلَيۡنَا لَا تُرۡجَعُونَ
phonetic: 23.115 'Afaĥasibtum 'Annamā Khalaqnākum `Abathāan Wa 'Annakum 'Ilaynā Lā Turja`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Did you think that We had created you in play (without any purpose), and that you would not be brought back to Us?"
translations.english_rwwad: Did you think that We created you with no purpose, and that you would not be brought back to Us?”

arabic_text: فَتَعَٰلَى ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡمَلِكُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡكَرِيمِ
phonetic: 23.116 Fata`ālá Allāhu Al-Maliku Al-Ĥaqqu Lā 'Ilāha 'Illā Huwa Rabbu Al-`Arshi Al-Karīmi

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[969]- And owner of everything in existence.
[970]- Or "the True Reality."

translations.english_saheeh: So exalted is Allāh, the Sovereign,[969] the Truth;[970] there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So Exalted be Allâh, the True King: Lâ ilâha illâ Huwa (none has the right to be worshipped but He), the Lord of the Supreme Throne!
translations.english_rwwad: Exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign! None has the right to be worshiped except Him, the Lord of the Honorable Throne.

arabic_text: وَمَن يَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ لَا بُرۡهَٰنَ لَهُۥ بِهِۦ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُۥ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦٓۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفۡلِحُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ
phonetic: 23.117 Wa Man Yad`u Ma`a Allāhi 'Ilahāan 'Ākhara Lā Burhāna Lahu Bihi Fa'innamā Ĥisābuhu `Inda Rabbihi 'Innahu Lā Yufliĥu Al-Kāfirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And whoever invokes besides Allāh another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And whoever invokes (or worships), besides Allâh, any other ilâh (god), of whom he has no proof; then his reckoning is only with his Lord. Surely! Al-Kâfirûn (the disbelievers in Allâh and in the Oneness of Allâh, polytheists, pagans, idolaters) will not be successful.
translations.english_rwwad: Whoever supplicates another god besides Allah, for which he has no proof, his reckoning will be with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will never succeed.

arabic_text: وَقُل رَّبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ وَٱرۡحَمۡ وَأَنتَ خَيۡرُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
phonetic: 23.118 Wa Qul Rabbi Aghfir Wa Arĥam Wa 'Anta Khayru Ar-Rāĥimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And, [O Muḥammad], say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for You are the Best of those who show mercy!"
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and you are the Best of those who show mercy.”
